name: unsounded
content:
unsounded adjective
(SILENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not said aloud or not making a noise that can be heard: The post-vowel written r is unsounded in many British accents. The bass fills in the unsounded beats so that there is a call and response between the two instruments. Related word
sound verb (NOISE)
More examplesFewer examplesNone of his consonants go unsounded.These are the things that are left unsaid, or unsounded.

unsounded adjective
(EXTREME)
too extreme to be measured, understood, or discovered: unsounded depths On the surface, the characters give away very little, although they all reveal unsounded depths as the film progresses. Synonyms
fathomless
unfathomableRelated word
sound verb (WATER DEPTH)
